"Kouri, who's a vice president of the National Assn. of Chiefs of Police, has assembled traits such as superficial charm, an exaggerated sense of self-worth, glibness, lying, lack of remorse and manipulation of others.
 
 "These traits, Kouri points out in his analysis, are common to psychopathic serial killers.
 
 "But -- and here's the part that may spark some controversy and defensive discussion -- these traits are also common to American politicians. (Maybe you already suspected.)"
 Politicians share personality traits with serial killers: Study | Los Angeles Times
 
 Is this at all surprising? The opportunity to exercise control and power over others tends to attract the wrong type of people. I think this is a reason a perfect government can never exist. The closest you can come to a perfect government is having a system of checks and balances to keep abusive people in government from doing too much damage.

post_info.post_title: American Politicians Share Personality Traits With Serial Killers

Took you long enough to admit that people like Obama aren't fit to be in a government position.

 Compared with the previous administration, he's certainly the lesser evil.

 Not when he's indebted us to China for more money than we'll ever be able to pay off. Or all of the setbacks to the space program, all thanks to Obama.
